name: src/App.js
App
description:
App contains the orchestration logic for the entirety of what is being displayed for a given app, including the app chrome like navigation.
App communicates these changes to {@link Component}s via events so that they may react.

name: appendComponent
description: appendComponent adds the childComponent's dom to this Component's equivalent attributes.

name: src/Component.js
Binder
description:
Binder listens for events on {@link EventHandler}s or DOM elements and changes characteristics of an HTMLElement or Component in response.
This is part of what makes a Component "reactive".

name: listenTo
description:
Listen to a DOM or EventHandler event.
For example:
this.buttonDOM = dom.button()
this.listenTo('click', this.buttonDOM, this.handleClick)

this.textComponent = new TextComponent(...)
this.listenTo(Component.TextInputEvent, this.textComponent, (eventName, ...params) => { ... })

name: Component
description: `Component` contains the reactive logic for a responsive UI element.

name: cleanup
description:
Called to dispose of any resources used by this component.
Extending classes *should* override and call cleanup on sub-Components.

name: appendComponent
description: appendComponent adds the childComponent's dom to this Component's dom

name: removeComponent
description: removeComponent removes the childComponent's dom from this Component's dom.

name: appendTo
description:
A handy method for quick creation and setting of a parent:
this._fooComponent = new FooComponent().appendTo(parentComponent)

name: setName
description: Sets the data-name attribute on the dom

name: addClass
description: add class attributes to dom elements

name: removeClass
description: remove class attributes to the dom

name: listenTo
description:
Listen to a DOM or Component event.
For example:
this.buttonDOM = dom.button()
this.listenTo('click', this.buttonDOM, this.handleClick)

this.textComponent = new TextComponent(...)
this.listenTo(Component.TextInputEvent, this.textComponent, (eventName, ...params) => { ... })

params.name: once
params.description: only listen to the first event, then unbind

name: src/DOM.js
domElementFunction
description:
domElementFunction is the behind the scenes logic for the functions like dom.div(...)
Below you will find the loop that uses domElementFunction

name: dom
description: Functions that generate Document Object Model (DOM) elements like dom.div(...) will live in el

name: src/DataCollection.js
DataCollection
description: DataCollection represents an ordered list of DataModel instances

params.name: options.dataObject
params.description: the DataObject extending class to use to wrap each data item in this collection

name: src/DataModel.js
DataModel
description:
DataModel holds a map of string,value pairs, sometimes fetched from or sent to a back-end server.

It fires events when values are changed so that {Component}s and other logic can react.

params.name: fieldDataObjects
params.description: a map of dataField (string) to DataObject (class), used to create sub-objects in this Model's data

name: get
description: Find a value held within this DataModel.

return.description: may be native types or, if mapped by options.fieldDataObjects, another DataObject

name: set
description: Set a key/value pair

name: setBatch
description:
Set a group of values. The 'values' parameter should be an object that works in for(key in values) loops like a dictionary: {}
If a key is in options.fieldDataObjects then the value will be used to contruct a DataObject and that will be the saved value.

name: src/DataObject.js
DataObject
description:
The abstract class for DataModel and DataCollection
It holds the event mixin and the generic function of fetching data from a remote service

name: reset
description: Clear out old data and set it to data, should trigger a 'reset' event

name: _innerFetch
description:
Use this to override the use of window.fetch
For example, MockService overrides this to intercept fetch calls and return its own responses for matched endpoints

name: fetchAll
description:
Fetch each DataObject and then wait for them all to return
Note: this resolves when the fetches complete, regardless of whether they succeed or fail.

name: src/EventHandler.js
EventListener
description: EventListener holds information about listeners on an object with the EventHandler

name: EventHandler
description: EventHandler is the base class that implements event distribution

name: trigger
description: Send an event to listeners

params.name: eventName
params.description: a string or Symbol indicating the event to watch

params.name: callback
params.description: often includes more parameters that are specific to the event

params.name: once
params.description: If true then the listener is removed after receiving one event

name: src/Localizer.js
Localizer
description:
Localizer provides the functionality necessary to:

- pick a string translation based on language
- format dates based on locale and time zone

name: gathering
description: This should NOT be turned on in production because it continuously grows in memory.

return.description: true if the Localizer is accumulating strings to translate

name: dateFieldOrder
description: Different locales order their dates in various ways: mm/dd/yyyy or yyyy.mm.dd or 2012 12 20

return.description: a length 3 array of 'day', 'month', and 'year' in the order that this locale renders date fields

name: Translation
description: Translation holds a map of source phrases to translated phrases in a given language

name: lt
description: A shorthand function for getting a translation

params.name: defaultValue
params.description: the value to return if there is no translation

name: ld
description: A shorthand function for getting a localized date

return.description: a localized string representing the date

name: ldt
description: A shorthand function for getting a localized date and time

return.description: a localized string representing the date and time

name: ldo
description: A shorthand function for getting a localized date or time string using your own options

return.description: a localized string representing the date

name: src/MockService.js
src/Router.js
src/module.js
content:
import App from './App.js'
import dom from './DOM.js'
import Router from './Router.js'
import Component from './Component.js'
import DataModel from './DataModel.js'
import Localizer from './Localizer.js'
import DataObject from './DataObject.js'
import MockService from './MockService.js'
import DataCollection from './DataCollection.js'

/**
 * This is used by rollup to create a handy all-in-one ES module
 */

export { App, dom, Router, Component, DataModel, Localizer, DataObject, MockService, DataCollection }
# Bink: A sleek reactive framework for web pages
name: ./README.md
package.json
